# Clean-up environment

```{r}
rm(list = ls(all.names = TRUE)) # will clear all objects includuing hidden objects
gc() # free up memory and report the memory usage
options(max.print = .Machine$integer.max,
        scipen = 999,
        stringsAsFactors = FALSE,
        dplyr.summarise.inform = FALSE) # Print everything without truncation, avoid scientific notation, keep strings as characters, silence dplyr’s “grouped output” informational messages
set.seed(42) # set seed for reproducibility
```

# User defined functions

```{r}
# Helper function (put this at the top of your script)
save_if <- function(plot_object, filename, width, height, ...) {
  if (save_plots) {
    ggsave(plot = plot_object,
           filename = filename,
           width = width,
           height = height,
           dpi = 300)
  }
}
# change to TRUE to save plots
save_plots <- TRUE
```

# Explore clusters 10 and 17

```{r}
cluster_17 <- subset(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6@meta.data, seurat_clusters %in% 17)

# make sure seurat clusters are the current identity
Idents(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6) <- "seurat_clusters"

DimPlot(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6,
        reduction = "umap",
        group.by = "seurat_clusters",
        label = FALSE,
        repel = TRUE,
        
        # Highlight only cluster 17
        cells.highlight = WhichCells(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6, idents = "17"),
        cols.highlight = 'red',
        cols = "grey80",
        sizes.highlight = 1.2,
        pt.size = 0.6) +
  NoLegend() +
  labs(title = "UMAP: Cluster 17",
       caption = "Filtered: Interesting cells")

# Make sure the active identity is your clustering
Idents(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6) <- "seurat_clusters"

# Find markers: cluster 10 vs cluster 17 only
markers_10_vs_17 <- FindMarkers(
  re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6,
  ident.1 = "10",                # positive markers = upregulated in 10
  ident.2 = "17",                # compared against 17
  test.use = "wilcox",           # or "MAST", "LR", etc.
  min.pct = 0.25,                # genes detected in ≥25% of cells in at least one group
  logfc.threshold = 0.25,        # minimum log2 fold-change
  verbose = FALSE
)

# Add gene name as column (makes downstream easier)
markers_10_vs_17$gene <- rownames(markers_10_vs_17)

# Optional: filter to significant & sort by logFC or p-val
markers_10_vs_17_sig <- markers_10_vs_17 %>%
  filter(p_val_adj < 0.05) %>%
  arrange(desc(avg_log2FC))         # highest fold-change in 10 first

# View top 10
head(markers_10_vs_17_sig, 10)

# Get top 10 genes upregulated in cluster 10
top10_10vs17 <- markers_10_vs_17 %>%
  filter(avg_log2FC > 0) %>%          # upregulated in 10
  arrange(desc(avg_log2FC)) %>%
  slice_head(n = 10) %>%
  pull(gene)

# Or top 10 upregulated in 17 vs 10 (reverse)
top10_17vs10 <- markers_10_vs_17 %>%
  filter(avg_log2FC < 0) %>%
  arrange(desc(abs(avg_log2FC))) %>%
  slice_head(n = 10) %>%
  pull(gene)

# Now make the DotPlot using only these genes
DotPlot(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6,
        features = top10_10vs17,          # or top10_17vs10
        group.by = "seurat_clusters",
        dot.scale = 8,
        cols = c("lightgrey", "red"),     # low to high expression
        col.min = -2, col.max = 2) +      # adjust scale if needed
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, vjust = 0.5)) +
  labs(title = "Top markers: Cluster 10 vs 17",
       subtitle = "Upregulated in cluster 10",
       y = "Cluster") +
  NoLegend()   # optional

top_markers_both <- c(
  markers_10_vs_17 %>% filter(avg_log2FC > 0) %>% arrange(desc(avg_log2FC)) %>% slice_head(n = 8) %>% pull(gene),
  markers_10_vs_17 %>% filter(avg_log2FC < 0) %>% arrange(desc(abs(avg_log2FC))) %>% slice_head(n = 8) %>% pull(gene)
) %>% unique()

DotPlot(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6,
        features = top_markers_both,
        group.by = "seurat_clusters",
        dot.scale = 7) +
  RotatedAxis() +
  labs(title = "Top markers: Cluster 10 vs 17 (both directions)")
```

# Rename filtered and uncertain cells

```{r}

# How many cells are we talking about here?
dim(subset(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6@meta.data, sophie_celltype_clean == "filtered"))
# [1]  2 53
dim(subset(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6@meta.data, sophie_celltype_clean == "uncertain"))
# [1]  1 53

# save the new seurat object
write_rds(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6,
      file.path(out_dir, "re_embed_interesting_0.6_rename.rds"))

# make sure Sophie's clusters are the current identity
Idents(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6) <- "sophie_celltype_clean"

DimPlot(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6,
        reduction = "umap",
        group.by = "sophie_celltype_clean",
        label = FALSE,
        repel = TRUE,
        cells.highlight = WhichCells(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6, idents = "filtered"),
        cols.highlight = 'red',
        cols = "grey80",
        sizes.highlight = 1.2,
        pt.size = 0.6) +
  NoLegend() +
  labs(title = "UMAP: 'filtered'only",
       caption = "Filtered: Interesting cells")

# rename the 2 cells currently annotated as "filtered" to "VSMC"
re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6@meta.data <- re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6@meta.data %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    sophie_celltype_clean = if_else(
      sophie_celltype_clean == "filtered",
      "VSMC",
      sophie_celltype_clean
    )
  )

DimPlot(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6,
        reduction = "umap",
        group.by = "sophie_celltype_clean",
        label = FALSE,
        repel = TRUE,
        cells.highlight = WhichCells(re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6, idents = "uncertain"),
        cols.highlight = 'red',
        cols = "grey80",
        sizes.highlight = 1.2,
        pt.size = 0.6) +
  NoLegend() +
  labs(title = "UMAP: 'uncertain' only",
       caption = "Filtered: Interesting cells")

# rename the 1 cell currently annotated as "uncertain" to "Mesenchyme"
re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6@meta.data <- re_embed_intersting_cells_0.6@meta.data %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    sophie_celltype_clean = if_else(
      sophie_celltype_clean == "uncertain",
      "Mesenchyme",
      sophie_celltype_clean
    )
  )
```
